verses.verse: Now the Philistines<WH6430> gathered<WH622> their armies<WH4264> for battle;<WH4421> and they were gathered<WH622> at Socoh<WH7755> which<WH834> belongs to Judah,<WH3063> and they camped<WH2583> between<WH996> Socoh<WH7755> and Azekah,<WH5825> in Ephes-dammim.

And Saul<WH7586> and the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> were gathered,<WH622> and camped<WH2583> in the valley<WH6010> of Elah,<WH424> and drew<WH6186> up in battle<WH4421> array to encounter<WH7122> the Philistines.<WH6430>

And the Philistines<WH6430> stood<WH5975> on the mountain<WH2022> on one<WH2088> side<WH2088> while Israel<WH3478> stood<WH5975> on the mountain<WH2022> on the other<WH2088> side,<WH2088> with the valley<WH1516> between<WH996> them.

Then a champion<WH376> <WH996> came<WH3318> out from the armies<WH4264> of the Philistines<WH6430> named<WH8034> Goliath,<WH1555> from Gath,<WH1661> whose height<WH1363> was six<WH8337> cubits<WH520> and a span.<WH2239>
And [he had] a bronze<WH5178> helmet<WH3553> on his head,<WH7218> and he was clothed<WH3847> with scale-armor which weighed<WH4948> five<WH2568> thousand<WH505> shekels<WH8255> of bronze.<WH5178>
[He] also [had] bronze<WH5178> greaves<WH4697> on his legs<WH7272> and a bronze<WH5178> javelin<WH3591> [slung] between<WH996> his shoulders.<WH3802>

And the shaft<WH2671> of his spear<WH2595> was like a weaver's beam,<WH4500> and the head<WH3852> of his spear<WH2595> [weighed] six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> shekels<WH8255> of iron;<WH1270> his shield-carrier also walked<WH1980> before<WH6440> him.

And he stood<WH5975> and shouted<WH7121> to the ranks<WH4634> of Israel,<WH3478> and said<WH559> to them, "Why<WH4100> do you come<WH3318> out to draw<WH6186> up in battle<WH4421> array? Am I not the Philistine<WH6430> and you servants<WH5650> of Saul<WH7586>? Choose<WH1262> a man<WH376> for yourselves and let him come<WH3381> down<WH3381> to me.

"If<WH518> he is able<WH3201> to fight<WH3898> with me and kill<WH5221> me, then we will become<WH1961> your servants;<WH5650> but if<WH518> I prevail<WH3201> against him and kill<WH5221> him, then you shall become<WH1961> our servants<WH5650> and serve<WH5647> us."
Again the Philistine<WH6430> said,<WH559> "I defy<WH2778> the ranks<WH4634> of Israel<WH3478> this<WH2088> day;<WH3117> give<WH5414> me a man<WH376> that we may fight<WH3898> together.<WH3162>"
When Saul<WH7586> and all<WH3605> Israel<WH3478> heard<WH8085> these<WH428> words<WH1697> of the Philistine,<WH6430> they were dismayed<WH2865> and greatly<WH3966> afraid.<WH3372>

Now David<WH1732> was the son<WH1121> of the Ephrathite<WH673> of Bethlehem<WH1035> in Judah,<WH3063> whose name<WH8034> was Jesse,<WH3448> and he had eight<WH8083> sons.<WH1121> And Jesse was old<WH2204> in the days<WH3117> of Saul,<WH7586> advanced<WH935> [in years] among men.<WH376>

And the three<WH7969> older<WH1419> sons<WH1121> of Jesse<WH3448> had gone<WH1980> after<WH310> Saul<WH7586> to the battle.<WH4421> And the names<WH8034> of his three<WH7969> sons<WH1121> who<WH834> went<WH1980> to the battle<WH4421> were Eliab<WH446> the first-born, and the second<WH4932> to him Abinadab,<WH41> and the third<WH7992> Shammah.<WH8048>
And David<WH1732> was the youngest.<WH6996> Now the three<WH7969> oldest<WH1419> followed<WH1980> <WH310> Saul,<WH7586>
but David<WH1732> went<WH1980> <WH7725> back<WH7725> and forth from Saul<WH7586> to tend<WH7462> his father's flock<WH6629> at Bethlehem.<WH1035>
And the Philistine<WH6430> came<WH5066> forward<WH5066> morning<WH7925> and evening<WH6150> for forty<WH705> days,<WH3117> and took<WH3320> his stand.<WH3320>

Then Jesse<WH3448> said<WH559> to David<WH1732> his son,<WH1121> "Take<WH3947> now<WH4994> for your brothers<WH251> an ephah<WH374> of this<WH2088> roasted<WH7039> grain<WH7039> and these<WH2088> ten<WH6235> loaves,<WH3899> and run<WH7323> to the camp<WH4264> to your brothers.<WH251>

"Bring<WH935> also these<WH428> ten<WH6235> cuts<WH2757> of cheese<WH2461> to the commander<WH8269> of [their] thousand,<WH505> and look<WH6485> into the welfare<WH7965> of your brothers,<WH251> and bring<WH3947> back news<WH6161> of them.
"For Saul<WH7586> and they and all<WH3605> the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> are in the valley<WH6010> of Elah,<WH424> fighting<WH3898> with the Philistines.<WH6430>"

So David<WH1732> arose<WH7925> early<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242> and left<WH5203> the flock<WH6629> with a keeper<WH8104> and took<WH5375> [the supplies] and went<WH1980> as Jesse<WH3448> had commanded<WH6680> him. And he came<WH935> to the circle<WH4570> of the camp<WH4570> while the army<WH2428> was going<WH3318> out in battle<WH4634> array<WH4634> shouting<WH7321> the war<WH4421> cry.<WH7321>
And Israel<WH3478> and the Philistines<WH6430> drew<WH6186> up in battle<WH6186> array, army<WH4634> against<WH7122> army.<WH4634>

Then David<WH1732> left<WH5203> his baggage<WH3627> in the care<WH3027> of the baggage<WH3627> keeper,<WH8104> and ran<WH7323> to the battle<WH4634> line<WH4634> and entered<WH935> in order to greet<WH7592> <WH7965> his brothers.<WH251>

As he was talking<WH1696> with them, behold,<WH2009> the champion,<WH376> <WH996> the Philistine<WH6430> from Gath<WH1661> named<WH8034> Goliath,<WH1555> was coming<WH5927> up from the army<WH4634> of the Philistines,<WH6430> and he spoke<WH1696> these<WH428> same<WH428> words;<WH1697> and David<WH1732> heard<WH8085> [them].
When all<WH3605> the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> saw<WH7200> the man,<WH376> they fled<WH5127> from him and were greatly<WH3966> afraid.<WH3372>

And the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> said,<WH559> "Have you seen<WH7200> this<WH2088> man<WH376> who is coming<WH5927> up? Surely<WH3588> he is coming<WH5927> up to defy<WH2778> Israel.<WH3478> And it will be that the king<WH4428> will enrich<WH6238> the man<WH376> who<WH834> kills<WH5221> him with great<WH1419> riches<WH6239> and will give<WH5414> him his daughter<WH1323> and make<WH6213> his father's house<WH1004> free<WH2670> in Israel.<WH3478>"

Then David<WH1732> spoke<WH559> to the men<WH376> who were standing<WH5975> by him, saying,<WH559> "What<WH4100> will be done<WH6213> for the man<WH376> who<WH834> kills<WH5221> this<WH1975> Philistine,<WH6430> and takes<WH5493> away<WH5493> the reproach<WH2781> from Israel<WH3478>? For who<WH4310> is this<WH2088> uncircumcised<WH6189> Philistine,<WH6430> that he should taunt<WH2778> the armies<WH4634> of the living<WH2416> God<WH430>?"
And the people<WH5971> answered<WH559> him in accord with this<WH2088> word,<WH1697> saying,<WH559> "Thus<WH3541> it will be done<WH6213> for the man<WH376> who<WH834> kills<WH5221> him."

Now Eliab<WH446> his oldest<WH1419> brother<WH251> heard<WH8085> when he spoke<WH1696> to the men;<WH376> and Eliab's anger<WH639> burned<WH2734> against David<WH1732> and he said,<WH559> "Why<WH4100> have you come<WH3381> down<WH3381>? And with whom<WH4310> have you left<WH5203> those<WH2007> few<WH4592> sheep<WH6629> in the wilderness<WH4057>? I know<WH3045> your insolence<WH2087> and the wickedness<WH7455> of your heart;<WH3824> for you have come<WH3381> down<WH3381> in order<WH4616> to see<WH7200> the battle.<WH4421>"
But David<WH1732> said,<WH559> "What<WH4100> have I done<WH6213> now<WH6258>? Was it not just a question<WH1697>?"

Then he turned<WH5437> away<WH5437> <WH681> from him to another<WH312> and said<WH559> the same<WH2088> thing;<WH1697> and the people<WH5971> answered<WH7725> the same<WH1697> thing<WH1697> as before.<WH7223>
When the words<WH1697> which<WH834> David<WH1732> spoke<WH1696> were heard,<WH8085> they told<WH5046> [them] to Saul,<WH7586> and he sent<WH3947> for him.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Saul,<WH7586> "Let no<WH408> man's heart<WH3820> fail<WH5307> on account<WH5921> of him; your servant<WH5650> will go<WH1980> and fight<WH3898> with this<WH2088> Philistine.<WH6430>"

Then Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> "You are not able<WH3201> to go<WH1980> against<WH413> this<WH2088> Philistine<WH6430> to fight<WH3898> with him; for you are [but] a youth<WH5271> while he has been a warrior<WH4421> from his youth.<WH5271>"

But David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Saul,<WH7586> "Your servant<WH5650> was tending<WH7462> his father's sheep.<WH6629> When a lion<WH738> or a bear<WH1677> came<WH935> and took<WH5375> a lamb<WH7716> from the flock,<WH5739>

I went<WH3318> out after<WH310> him and attacked<WH5221> him, and rescued<WH5337> [it] from his mouth;<WH6310> and when he rose<WH6965> up against<WH5921> me, I seized<WH2388> [him] by his beard<WH2206> and struck<WH5221> him and killed<WH4191> him.

"Your servant<WH5650> has killed<WH5221> both<WH1571> the lion<WH738> and the bear;<WH1677> and this<WH2088> uncircumcised<WH6189> Philistine<WH6430> will be like one<WH259> of them, since<WH3588> he has taunted<WH2778> the armies<WH4634> of the living<WH2416> God.<WH430>"

And David<WH1732> said,<WH559> "The Lord<WH3068> who<WH834> delivered<WH5337> me from the paw<WH3027> of the lion<WH738> and from the paw<WH3027> of the bear,<WH1677> He will deliver<WH5337> me from the hand<WH3027> of this<WH2088> Philistine.<WH6430>" And Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> "Go,<WH1980> and may the Lord<WH3068> be with you."
Then Saul<WH7586> clothed<WH3847> David<WH1732> with his garments<WH4055> and put<WH5414> a bronze<WH5178> helmet<WH6959> on his head,<WH7218> and he clothed<WH3847> him with armor.<WH8302>

And David<WH1732> girded<WH2296> his sword<WH2719> over<WH4480> <WH5921> his armor<WH4055> and tried<WH2974> to walk,<WH1980> for he had not tested<WH5254> [them.] So David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Saul,<WH7586> "I cannot<WH3201> <WH3808> go<WH1980> with these,<WH428> for I have not tested<WH5254> [them]." And David<WH1732> took<WH5493> them off.<WH4480> <WH5921>

And he took<WH3947> his stick<WH4731> in his hand<WH3027> and chose<WH977> for himself five<WH2568> smooth<WH2512> stones<WH68> from the brook,<WH5158> and put<WH7760> them in the shepherd's bag<WH3627> which<WH834> he had, even in [his] pouch,<WH3219> and his sling<WH9521> was in his hand;<WH3027> and he approached<WH5066> the Philistine.<WH6430>
Then the Philistine<WH6430> came<WH1980> on and approached<WH7126> David,<WH1732> with the shield-bearer in front<WH6440> of him.
When the Philistine<WH6430> looked<WH5027> and saw<WH7200> David,<WH1732> he disdained<WH959> him; for he was [but] a youth,<WH5288> and ruddy,<WH132> with a handsome<WH3303> appearance.<WH4758>

And the Philistine<WH6430> said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> "Am I a dog,<WH3611> that you come<WH935> to me with sticks<WH4731>?" And the Philistine<WH6430> cursed<WH7043> David<WH1732> by his gods.<WH430>

The Philistine<WH6430> also said<WH559> to David,<WH1732> "Come<WH1980> to me, and I will give<WH5414> your flesh<WH1320> to the birds<WH5775> of the sky<WH8064> and the beasts<WH929> of the field.<WH7704>"

Then David<WH1732> said<WH559> to the Philistine,<WH6430> "You come<WH935> to me with a sword,<WH2719> a spear,<WH2595> and a javelin,<WH3591> but I come<WH935> to you in the name<WH8034> of the Lord<WH3068> of hosts,<WH6635> the God<WH430> of the armies<WH4634> of Israel,<WH3478> whom<WH834> you have taunted.<WH2778>

"This<WH2088> day<WH3117> the Lord<WH3068> will deliver<WH5462> you up into my hands,<WH3027> and I will strike<WH5221> you down<WH5221> and remove<WH5493> your head<WH7218> from you. And I will give<WH5414> the dead<WH6297> bodies<WH6297> of the army<WH4264> of the Philistines<WH6430> this<WH2088> day<WH3117> to the birds<WH5775> of the sky<WH8064> and the wild<WH9130> beasts<WH9130> of the earth,<WH776> that all<WH3605> the earth<WH776> may know<WH3045> that there<WH3426> is a God<WH430> in Israel,<WH3478>

and that all<WH3605> this<WH2088> assembly<WH6951> may know<WH3045> that the Lord<WH3068> does not deliver<WH3467> by sword<WH2719> or by spear;<WH2595> for the battle<WH4421> is the Lord's and He will give<WH5414> you into our hands.<WH3027> "

Then it happened<WH1961> when<WH3588> the Philistine<WH6430> rose<WH6965> and came<WH1980> and drew<WH7126> near<WH7126> to meet<WH7122> David,<WH1732> that David<WH1732> ran<WH7323> quickly<WH4116> toward the battle<WH4634> line<WH4634> to meet<WH7122> the Philistine.<WH6430>

And David<WH1732> put<WH7971> his hand<WH3027> into his bag<WH3627> and took<WH3947> from it a stone<WH68> and slung<WH7049> [it], and struck<WH5221> the Philistine<WH6430> on his forehead.<WH4696> And the stone<WH68> sank<WH2883> into his forehead,<WH4696> so that he fell<WH5307> on his face<WH6440> to the ground.<WH776>

Thus David<WH1732> prevailed<WH2388> over<WH4480> the Philistine<WH6430> with a sling<WH9521> and a stone,<WH68> and he struck<WH5221> the Philistine<WH6430> and killed<WH4191> him; but there<WH369> was no<WH369> sword<WH2719> in David's hand.<WH3027>

Then David<WH1732> ran<WH7323> and stood<WH5975> over<WH413> the Philistine<WH6430> and took<WH3947> his sword<WH2719> and drew<WH8025> it out of its sheath<WH8593> and killed<WH4191> him, and cut<WH3772> off<WH3772> his head<WH7218> with it. And the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> and Judah<WH3063> arose<WH6965> and shouted<WH7321> and pursued<WH7291> the Philistines<WH6430> as far<WH5704> as the valley,<WH1516> and to the gates<WH8179> of Ekron.<WH6138> And the slain<WH2491> Philistines<WH6430> lay<WH5307> along the way<WH1870> to Shaaraim,<WH8189> even to Gath<WH1661> and Ekron.<WH6138>
And the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> returned<WH7725> from chasing<WH1814> the Philistines<WH6430> and plundered<WH8155> their camps.<WH4264>
Then David<WH1732> took<WH3947> the Philistine's head<WH7218> and brought<WH935> it to Jerusalem,<WH3389> but he put<WH7760> his weapons<WH3627> in his tent.<WH168>

Now when Saul<WH7586> saw<WH7200> David<WH1732> going<WH3318> out against<WH7122> the Philistine,<WH6430> he said<WH559> to Abner<WH74> the commander<WH8269> of the army,<WH6635> "Abner,<WH74> whose<WH4310> son<WH1121> is this<WH2088> young<WH5288> man<WH5288>?"
